definition: top of streets, bottom of alleys (idiom); everywhere in the city
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]
tail/remainder/remnant/extremity/sixth of the 28 constellations/classifier for fish
horse's tail/pointed posterior section of a locust etc

sentences.english: But reality on the street was teaching him a very different lesson.
sentences.chinese: 但街头巷尾的现实给他上了一堂截然不同的课。

sentences.english: I would feel better if there were video cameras on most street corners, to prevent crime.
sentences.chinese: 在街头巷尾安装摄录机会让我觉得更安全。

sentences.english: Burnt to cinders, we were told by the neighbourhood gossips .
sentences.chinese: 街头巷尾都在传他被烧成了灰烬。

sentences.english: The divorced woman is the talk of the street.
sentences.chinese: 那个离了婚的女子成了街头巷尾的话题。

sentences.english: It is the talk of the town.
sentences.chinese: 这已是街头巷尾谈论的事了。

definition: great streets and small alleys (idiom); everywhere in the city
marketplace/town/the street (urban milieu)/the haunts of the common people
leisure time (over a cup of tea, after a meal etc)
Mancheng county in Baoding 保定[Bao3 ding4], Hebei
